intro: Pedicularis globifera, commonly known as the globeflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic plants. The plant is characterized by its unique, inflated floral structure that resembles a small globe, hence its common name. It typically grows at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, moist environments. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in late spring to early summer.
